content: I have installed 1.5.1, but I found that my domain name is (xxx@acme.com), xxx could be the short name that I have provided. As the bot name will be like *-bot@xxx@acme.com, it will always fail the name verification if I want to add a new bot
Hi @wen lu -- are you saying the bot name will include two @ signs?

yeah, this is a bug we just tracked down over the weekend; under certain circumstances one would get an invalid bot email domain. I think we'll need to do a release to fix this for everyone, but as a workaround you can just edit realm.domain in a manage.py shell. Happy to provide details if you're not familiar with how to do this in Django :)
thanks. I have just fixed the realm value in database manually
